required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Point-of-Care RBC Washing to Prevent Transfusion-Related Pulmonary Complications
clinical_study.official_title: Point-of-Care RBC Washing to Prevent Transfusion-Related Pulmonary Complications

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to determine if point-of-care washing of allogeneic Leukocyte-Reduced Red Blood Cells reduces pulmonary complications when compared to standard-of-care Leukocyte-Reduced Red Blood Cells in a cardiac surgical population.

primary_outcome.measure: Biomarkers Associated With Transfusion-Related Acute Lung Injury and Transfusion Associated Circulatory Overload.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 18 hours after the initiation of the first red blood cell transfusion.
primary_outcome.description: This panel of biomarkers measures inflammation, altered coagulation, and endothelial activation all of which play key roles in the pathogenesis of lung injury.

The number of standard issued red blood cell units that were transfused to study participants in the washed red blood cell arm of the trial. Additionally, emergency red blood cell transfusions in the standard issued arm of the trial that were administered outside of the study protocol were also included to the definition of "off protocol" transfusion.
Change in Hemoglobin from pre-transfusion to post-transfusion

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Recipient Cell Free Hemoglobin(CFH)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre transfusion until study day 5 or hospital discharge, approximately 5 days
primary_outcome.description: Change in CFH from pre-transfusion to worst (highest/maximum) post-transfusion

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre transfusion to study day 5 or hospital discharge, approximately 5 days
primary_outcome.description: Change in Haptoglobin from pre-transfusion to worst (minimum) post-transfusion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to hospital day 28, or discharge, whichever comes first
secondary_outcome.description: Number of hours subject received mechanical ventilation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to day 28, or hospital discharge, whichever comes first
secondary_outcome.description: Number of hours subjects received supplemental oxygen.

Worst SOFA score between Day 1 and Day 5. SOFA scores range from 0-24 with 0 meaning no organ dysfunction and 24 means severe dysfunction of all organ systems evaluated. Each of 6 organ systems are scored on a 0-4 scale with the cumulative score being the total SOFA score.
Number of days subject remained in the hospital following their surgical procedure. If the number of days the subject remained in the hospital exceeded 28, a value of 28 is assigned.
Development of transfusion-related lung injury (TRALI) or transfusion-associated circulatory overload (TACO).

arm_group.description: Red blood cells that are administered in the normal fashion.

arm_group.description: Red blood cells that are washed at the point-of-care.

intervention.intervention_name: Point-of-care washed red blood cell transfusion.
intervention.arm_group_label: Point-of-Care washed red blood cell transfusion

intervention.intervention_name: Standard of care red blood cell transfusion.
intervention.arm_group_label: Standard of care red blood cell transfusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age equal to or greater than 18 years of age.
- Scheduled to have cardiac bypass surgery at Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota or Duke University Medical Center in Durham, North Carolina
- At risk for needing at least 4 units of blood during/after surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Emergency surgery
- Immunoglobulin A (IgA) deficiency
- History of severe recurrent transfusion reactions
- Refusal to receive allogeneic blood products
- Refusal to provide informed consent
- Prevalent lung injury prior to randomization
- Prevalent congestive heart failure prior to randomization
- Expected hospital stay < 48 hours
- Not anticipated to survive > 48 hours
- Previously enrolled in this trial
- No plan for placement of a pulmonary artery catheter
- Use of home oxygen therapy
- Complex RBC antibody profiles
- Need for the use of irradiated RBCs

outcome.title: Biomarkers Associated With Transfusion-Related Acute Lung Injury and Transfusion Associated Circulatory Overload.
outcome.description: This panel of biomarkers measures inflammation, altered coagulation, and endothelial activation all of which play key roles in the pathogenesis of lung injury.
outcome.time_frame: 18 hours after the initiation of the first red blood cell transfusion.
outcome.population: Patients undergoing cardiac surgery who were predicted to be at high risk for requiring red blood cell transfusion.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
